CAREER SUMMARY  
 
2018 to date: AVEVA ( Integr ated Schneider  Electr ic’s Industrial Software Business )  
Provider of tec hnology and software to the Hydrocarbon Processing Industry.  
 
Apr 2019 to date:   
Position: Director, Digital Transformation  
 
Jan 2018 – Mar 2019   
Position: Senior Manager , Business De velopment  
Development and generation of strategic business opportunities, with primary focus on digital transformation to 
unlock business value for global Oil & Gas clients.  
 
2011 – 2019 Schneider Electric  – Dubai,  Middle East  
 
2015 – 2019  
Position: Consulting Director, Middle East, North Africa and Asia  
• Provided consultative sales and value consulting to multinational and regional clients.  
• Engaged regional sales te ams on new and existing business opportunities to improve pipelines and generate 
orders; generated about $15M in orders, and over $20M in pipeline in past 18 months.  
• Trusted advisor to multinational clients addressing business and operational challenges a nd proffer solutions 
accordingly.  
• Led client -facing activities, including business transformation and technical workshops, FEED studies, project 
reviews, and clients' digitization and IT master plans for Industry 4.0 initiatives.  
 
 
  
 
 
2013  – 2015 
Position: Senior  Manager, Project Delivery Engineering  (O&G)  
• Project Technical Director, responsible and accountable for technical delivery of a complex integrated refinery 
information system (IRIS) at a new greenfield export refinery in Saudi Arabia. Successfully delivered the $21M 
project on schedule and within budget.  
• Responsible for overall solution architecture and conformance of deployed refinery solutions to specifications.  
• Provided industry best practice advice to refinery clients and project teams regarding design, d evelopment, and 
deployment of such complex enterprise integrated systems, and ensured adherence to industry standards.  
• Established execution governance and implementation strategy for successful delivery of complex integrated 
oil and gas projects.  
 
2011 – 2013  
Position : Technical Director, Integrated Refinery Information Systems (IRIS) & MES  – Invens ys  
Invensys was a cquired by Schneider Electric  
• Program Technical Director, Saud i Aramco Total Refinery & Petrochemical Company (SATORP) IRIS Project, 
Jubail, Saudi Arabia.  
 
2010 – 2011 KBR Inc.  
Position: Technology Advisor (Process)  
• Project team lead, managed project interactions between Manufacturing Operations Management (MOM) team 
and system providers and across MOM functional groups, as well as client expectations  on FEED activities.  
• Led team to define functional and technical specifications for a complex integrated petrochemicals project and 
designed the enterprise architecture for supply chain and inventory operations component of project.  
• Lead Functional Analyst  on FEED for Dow/Saudi Aramco Petrochemical integrated project, responsible for 
defining requirements and design of enterprise system architecture for the supply chain and inventory 
management solution in MOM.  
 
1997 – 2010 Aspen Technology   
 
2008 – 2010  
Position: Petroleum Supply Chain Team Leader  
• Facilitated resource scheduling and engaged team members on billable project tasks to bolster services 
revenue.  
• Mentored team, led technical and design reviews, and developed best practice methodologies for petro leum 
supply chain and integration projects execution.
